column2: S from Redlands, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Feb. 9, 2011I have Fibromyalgia and have been on 750 mg once a day (along with Prozac 10mg) for 5 years. Three weeks ago I began experiencing ringing in both ears. Since this was a new symptom I had my ears checked for wax build up and then washed. However the ringing is still present in the left ear. I am extremely in tune with my body and am in  good shape. But after reading up on the side effects on Salsalate, and the included "postings" from others, I feel that this medication might be the culprit. I see an ENT specialist today and will repost those results. I too have noticed that Tylenol and regualr caffeine free Asprin work just as well, however, I am concerned about the long term side affects of those over the counter pills as well. Any advice?

column2: MOMM, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have used Salslate for 8 months for headaches and body/joint inflamation. Used in combination with Medical Marijuana (capsule/oral/oil) to treat muscle and joint pain it seems to work. I am never completely out of pain but experience a serious reduction in overall pain. Using MM as a topical muscle rub and taking orally before bed gets me a pretty good nights sleep. One problem......I developed a cripling abdomen pain last week and ended up in the ER. A CAT scan of internal organs showed no problems so the source of the pain had to be within the disgestive system. I stopped taking Salsalate for a few days and then started again. No serious abdominal pain yet....keeping my fingers crossed. When I went off the Salsalate for a couple of days, I went into a serious remission of overall body pain in joints, muscles and just about everywhere else. It must be helping because I am not back to tolerable pain levels. Hope this helps someone. MOMM in Grants Pass, Oregon.

column9: For the past year, my doctor / professor of rheumatology, tried high doses of steroids, then those combined with ENBREL, with very little effectiveness.  Then I started on 2 per day 750 mg Salsalate and within a few weeks I was off the ENBREL ($450 per day) and off the steroids that were giving me uncontrollable type 2 diabetis after a year of steroids.  My diabetis, blood pressure, and pain are under control and I am very happy with it.  However, if I miss a pill, within hours I will be in pain again.

column9: I have RA...my doctor took me off Celebrex(400mgs daily) to try to lower my b/p...well...after taking 4 750 mg tabs of Salsalate a day...my b/p is where it should be ( a little lower than normal) BUT...I'm expieriencing lower back pain and a lower abdominal ache...I take alot of other meds..ie.Methotrexate,Vitamins,Calcium,Hyzaar,Aml odipine,Metroprolol,Leucovorin,Folic Acid and I'm supposed to take 200mgs of Ultram but Medicare won't approve it ubtil i try 4 other meds first...so I walk around like I have the flu..in pain all the time (yes...I have Fibromyalgia also)..I have tried Bextra,Relafen,Enbrel and Humira...it seems only Celebrex worked but it puts my b/p extremely high....I'm between a rock and a hard place...I'm tired of trying new meds...been doing it for 10 years now...I have no energy left anymore.
